a.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "a" and "kin" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms.

akesi.commentary: akesi used to mean "non-cute animal," and is defined this way in pu, but this definition has fallen out of use and was later removed in the pu annotations published with ku.

ala.definition: no, non, zero; [~ ala ~] (usato per domande si-no); nulla

alasa.commentary: In some communities, the usage of "alasa" as a preverb meaning "try to" is equally or even more common than "lukin". In pu, only "lukin"/"oko" has this meaning.
alasa.definition: caccia, foraggio, ricerca, tentativo; (preverbo) provare, tentare
alasa.etymology: à la chasse: Acadian French, cacciare, (letteralmente) alla caccia

ale.commentary:
"ali" is an alternative to "ale", coined in a poll in 2002 in order to avoid confusion with "ala". However, the usage of "ale" over "ali" remains more common.
The majority of speakers report not understanding the "abundant, bountiful, plentiful" meaning, at least out of context.
"20, 120" were non-pu meanings previously in use in the community alongside 100; they are virtually unheard of nowadays.
ale.definition: tutto, tutti, ogni, interezza, universo; (numero) cento

ali.commentary: "ali" is an alternative to "ale", coined in a poll in 2002 in order to avoid confusion with "ala". However, the usage of "ale" over "ali" has been more common since at least the release of pu. Generally not considered a word in its own right.

anpa.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "anpa" has the meaning of "place that is down". In pu, "noka" has that meaning instead.

ante.definition: diverso, differente, alterato; modificare, cambiare; altro; differenza

anu.commentary: The usage of "anu" as a content word meaning "choose" remains controversial.

apeja.commentary: According to jan Sonja, "apeja" never appeared in any pre-pu toki pona dictionary made by her and never promoted by her, instead it may have been "just an experimental idea in a forum post".
apeja.definition: colpa, vergogna, rifiuto, stigma, disgrazia; accusare, individuare, esporre, disonorare, imbarazzare
apeja.etymology: häpeä: finlandese, vergogna, imbarazzo, disgrazia, disonore

awen.definition: duraturo, mantenuto, protetto, sicuro, che aspetta, che resta; (pv.) continuare a, mantenere
awen.etymology: houden: olandese, keep, care for, hold (in a particular state)

en.commentary: There are various analyses of the syntactic role of "en". Originally intended to be used as "and", it was changed (via poll in 2002) to just be used with "head nouns". One of the more recent analyses (including 2021's April Fools) treats "en" as a subject marker.
en.definition: (tra più soggetti) | ALT (coordina i modificatori in una frase con pi o gli oggetti di una preposizione)

esun.commentary: According to jan Sonja, "esun was told [to her] by a taxi driver who spoke a language from the Akan family in West Africa".
esun.definition: mercato, negozio, fiera, bazar, transazione commerciale

ijo.definition: cosa, oggetto, entità, essere, materia, fenomeno
ijo.etymology: io: Esperanto, something; i-: Romance, (relative pronoun root)

ike.definition: cattivo, negativo; non essenziale, irrilevante | ALT complicato, complesso

insa.definition: centro, contenuto, dentro, tra; organo interno, stomaco
insa.etymology: insait: Tok Pisin, inside, center, stomach; inside: inglese, inside

isipin.definition: pensare, immaginare, credere, ricordare, richiamare; un pensiero, un'idea

jaki.definition: disgustoso, osceno, nauseabondo, tossico, sporco, insalubre

jami.definition: gustoso; suscitare o stimolare un'esperienza sensoriale positiva

jan.commentary: There are two sides to the concept, "sentient entity" and "homo sapiens", which matters for whether to use the word in edge cases (i.e. aliens, humans turned into werewolves, etc). Which sense is more central to the word remains controversial.

jasima.definition: riflettere, risuonare, rispecchiare, essere all'estremità opposta/polare di

jelo.commentary: Some extend "jelo" to include lime green, but this usage is uncommon.

jonke.commentary: Coined in reference to the Untitled Goose Game fandom.

kalama.definition: produrre un suono; recitare, pronunciare ad alta voce
kalama.etymology: галама (galama): Serbo-Croatian, noise (of the human voice)

kama.definition: arrivare; in arrivo, futuro, evocato; (preverbo) diventare, riuscire
kama.etymology: kamap: Tok Pisin, event, arrive, happen, become, bring about, summon

kamalawala.commentary: The word is from a story called "jan pi Kamalawala". A character's name is described as "nimi Jan pi Kama e Lawa Ala", and a shortened version given as "nimi Kamalawala". jan Kipo is responsible for it becoming a word instead of just a name.
kamalawala.etymology: kama pi lawa ala: toki pona, 'arrival of no government', the beginning of anarchy

kapesi.etymology: 咖啡色 (gaa³ fe¹ sik¹): Cantonese, brown, coffee (colour); 咖啡色 (kāfēisè): mandarino, brown, coffee (colour)

ken.definition: potere, abilità, permesso; possibilità, forse; permettere; (preverbo) potere
ken.etymology: ken: Tok Pisin, can; can: inglese, can

kepeken.commentary: Whether "kepeken" should be used with or without "e" in a predicative position (meaning "to use") remains controversial.

kijetesantakalu.commentary: Coined as an April Fools joke in 2009.
kijetesantakalu.definition: qualsiasi animale della famiglia Procyonidae, come procioni, coatis, kinkajous, olingos, ringtail e cacomistles | ALT qualsiasi animale della superfamiglia Musteloidea, compresi procioni, donnole, lontre, puzzole e panda rossi

kiki.commentary: The word is loaned from the 2001 Vilanyur S Ramachandran & Edward Hubbard version of Wolfgang Köhler's 1912 psycholinguistic experiment. The experiment studied sound symbolism on the words "bouba" and "kiki".

kili.commentary: In post-ku 2021, metaphorical definitions for kili have been suggested, including but not limited to "offspring" and "product", and are moderately popular. It is not yet clear whether this will remain in use long-term.

kin.commentary:
In common usage (both before and after pu), "a" and "kin" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms.
Underwent significant changes in usage in 2002, alongside "en" and (now obsolete) "kan".
kin.definition: {vedi a} | ALT infatti, pure, anche, come pure

ko.commentary: The "clinging form" definition was elaborated to mean "a shape or mass that sticks or clings; a clot, a thick or viscous lump, a clump that can be reshaped".
ko.definition: semi-solido, per esempio impasto, polvere, melma, sabbia, terra, argilla; duttile, appiccicoso

kokosila.commentary: In Esperanto, "krokodili" means "to speak among Esperantists in a language besides Esperanto," and is an established bit of Esperanto culture.
kokosila.definition: parlare una lingua non Toki Pona in un ambiente in cui il Toki Pona è più appropriato
kokosila.etymology: krokodilas: Esperanto, to speak among Esperantists in a language other than Esperanto; krokodilo: Esperanto, crocodile

kon.definition: aria, respiro; essenza, spirito; realtà nascosta, agente invisibile
kon.etymology: 空氣 (kōngqì): mandarino, air, atmosphere, ambience, opinion

konwe.commentary:
Conway refers to John Horton Conway, creator of the cellular automaton Game of Life.
konwe's intended meaning extends beyond just "living" and "life." It can be used to describe rocks or rivers or other nonliving things
konwe.definition: animazione, vita, autonomia; essere autonomo, cosa vivente, organismo; vivo, animato, dinamico; animare, portare alla vita
konwe.etymology: Conway: inglese, John Conway, creator of The Game of Life; kon wile: toki pona, kon wile

ku.commentary: For ways to buy a copy of the book, visit the official Toki Pona website.
ku.definition: interagire con il libro Toki Pona Dictionary (2021) di Sonja Lang

kule.commentary: in addition to its pu-definitions, kule is sometimes used to talk about more general kinds of categories, like type, kind, flavour, gender, etc.
kule.definition: colore, pigmento; categoria, genere, sapore; colorato, vario

kulijo.definition: [interiezione] espressione casuale di apprezzamento o riconoscimento; figo, bene, ok

kulupu.etymology: kulupu: Tongan, group; group: inglese, group

kute.definition: orecchio, organo dell'udito; sentire, ascoltare, fare attenzione a, obbedire

la.definition: (particella) [segna ciò che precede come contesto di ciò che segue]
la.etymology: la: Esperanto, (definite article); la: Romance, (feminine singular definite article); -la: Acadian French, (proximal & topical suffix)

lanpan.etymology: λαμβάνω (lamváno): Greek, take, seize, grasp, receive

laso.etymology: glas: Welsh, blue, inexperienced; glas: Proto-Brythonic, green, blue

lawa.definition: testa, mente; controllare, dirigere, guidare, condurre, possedere, pianificare, regolare, governare

leko.definition: quadrato, cubo, blocco o simili, come mattoni e scalini
leko.etymology: Lego: inglese, Lego; leg godt: Danish, play well; lohko: finlandese, block, section

len.definition: panno, vestiti, tessuto; coperto, nascosto, segreto, privato

lete.etymology: frette: Acadian French, cold; freit: Old French, cold

li.definition: (tra qualsiasi soggetto tranne mi da solo o sina da solo e il suo verbo; anche per introdurre un nuovo verbo per lo stesso soggetto)
li.etymology: li: Esperanto, he; ille: Latin, he; i: Tok Pisin, he; he: inglese, he

lili.definition: poco, piccolo, breve; pochi; un po'; giovane
lili.etymology: liklik: Tok Pisin, small, little; liklik: Ramoaaina, small, little

linja.definition: cosa lunga e flessibile; corda, capelli, corda, filo, filato | ALT linea, connessione
linja.etymology: linja: finlandese, line; linia: Old Swedish, line

linluwi.definition: rete, internet, connessione; tessere, intrecciare, interconnettere

lipu.definition: oggetto piatto e pieghevole, per esempio carta, foglia, foglio; testo scritto, documento, per esempio libro, sito web, tavoletta d'argilla

lon.definition: presente, esistente, reale, vero; (preposizione) situato, in, durante, nel contesto di
lon.etymology: long: Tok Pisin, at, in, on, (spacial particle); along: inglese, along

luka.definition: mano, braccio, arto tattile, arto prensile; prendere, interagire con, percepire con il tatto; (numero) cinque

lukin.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances. The usage of "alasa" as a preverb meaning "try to" is more common than "lukin". In pu, only "lukin" has this meaning. A very common beginner mistake is treating "lukin" as if it means "appearance", due to the mistakenly equating the "visual" meaning as in "pona lukin (visually good)" to mean "looks good".
lukin.definition: vedere, guardare, visualizzare, esaminare, leggere; visivo; occhio, organo della vista; (preverbo) provare
lukin.etymology: lukim: Tok Pisin, see, look at; look: inglese, look; him: inglese, him

lupa.etymology: clupa: Lojban, loop; 圈 (quān): mandarino, loop; loop: inglese, loop; पाश (pāś): Hindi, loop; أنشوطة‏ (anšūṭa): Arabic, loop

ma.definition: terra; all'aperto, mondo; paese, territorio; suolo

majuna.etymology: maljuna: Esperanto, old (not young); malus: Latin, bad; jung: German, young; jeune: francese, young

mani.definition: denaro, contanti, risparmi, ricchezza; grande animale domestico
mani.etymology: money: inglese, money; fehu: Proto-Germanic, livestock; pecū: Latin, cattle

meli.definition: woman, female, feminine person, wife, girlfriend
meli.etymology: meri: Tok Pisin, woman, wife, feminine; mari: Tolai, pretty; Mary: inglese, Mary

melome.etymology: meli pi olin meli: toki pona, women loving women

meso.definition: mezzo, medio, mediocre; né l'uno né l'altro, né pienamente è né non è

mi.etymology: mi: Esperanto, I, me; m-: Romance, (1st person singular oblique)

mije.definition: man, male, masculine person, husband, boyfriend

mijomi.etymology: mije pi olin mije: toki pona, men loving men

misa.definition: Glires o Eulipotyphla; ratto, topo, scoiattolo, coniglio, roditore; {~ suli} capibara

misikeke.commentary: The word was used privately by jan Sonja up until November 2019, when she mentioned it in the ma pona pi toki pona discord server as a word she was experimenting with. It is believed the word was originally coined in 2007-2009 alongside pan, esun, apeja, monsuta, and pu, but this cannot be proven.

monsi.etymology: mon tchu: Acadian French, my ass (vulgar)

monsuta.definition: paura, timore; mostro, predatore; minaccia, pericolo
monsuta.etymology: モンスター (monsutā): giapponese, monster; monster: inglese, monster

mu.definition: (rumore o comunicazione animale) | ALT (vocalizzazione non verbale)

mun.definition: luna, corpo celeste, stella | ALT bagliore, luce incandescente, luce nel buio

musi.etymology: amuzi: Esperanto, amuse, entertain; amuser: francese, amuse, entertain

mute.definition: molti, tanto, di più, assai, parecchi, moltissimo; quantità | ALT tre (o più), 20
mute.etymology: multe: Esperanto, a lot; multus: Latin, a lot

n.definition: (indica pensiero, riflessione, riconoscimento, accordo o borbottio)

namako.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "sin" and "namako" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "namako" at all, preferring "sin" in all circumstances.
namako.definition: {vedi sin} | ALT abbellimento, spezia; extra, supplementare
namako.etymology: नमक (namak): Hindi, salt; نمک (namak): Persian, salt

nanpa.etymology: namba: Tok Pisin, number; number: inglese, number

nasin.definition: metodo, modo, dottrina, tradizione; percorso, strada, via

nena.definition: bozzo, pulsante, collina, montagna, naso, protuberanza

ni.etymology: 呢 (ni): Cantonese, this; 哩 (le): Tai, (continuation of a state/action)

nimisin.commentary: Mostly used in conversations in English. Likely was popularised by the :nimisin: emote in ma pona, which was originally used to notify Atawan (maintainer of "nimi ale") about newly coined words. In common speech, the meaning got extended to include most or all non-pu words, regardless if they were coined recently or not.
nimisin.definition: qualunque parola che non fa parte del pu; qualunque neologismo; qualunque parola meme
nimisin.etymology: nimi sin: toki pona, new word

noka.commentary: In a 2002 poll, "jalan" was proposed to replace "noka". However, it failed to get enough votes. In pu, "noka" has the meaning of "place that is down". In common usage (both before and after pu), "anpa" has that meaning instead. noka had speculative and/or joking use for numbers, comparable to luka: ten, twenty, negative five.
noka.definition: piede, gamba, organo di locomozione; fondo, parte inferiore

ojuta.definition: adattamento del meme inglese "ligma", letteralmente "o uta" (lecca)
ojuta.etymology: o uta: toki pona, 'lick my balls' (same as English 'ligma balls')

oko.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances, though some speakers do the opposite and use "oko" exclusively instead.
oko.definition: vedere, guardare, visualizzare, esaminare, leggere; visivo; occhio, organo della vista; (preverbo) provare

olin.commentary: In english, "love" can be used to mean "like a lot", but in toki pona, "olin" doesn't work that way. It indicates an emotional connection or bond, not preference
olin.definition: avere un grande legame emotivo con, per esempio affetto, apprezzamento, compassione, rispetto; relazioni platoniche, romantiche o familiari

omekapo.commentary: Coined by jan Maliku in reference to the message "o moku e kala pona", which jan Sonja wrote on their copy of Toki Pona: The Language of Good during a Texas meetup.
omekapo.definition: addio, alla prossima, letteralmente "o moku e kala pona" (mangia del buon pesce)
omekapo.etymology: o moku e kala pona: toki pona, 'eat a good fish', wishing somebody well

ona.commentary: Coined in a poll in 2002. Replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi", as well as "i" in a previous poll.

open.commentary: Some proficient speakers use open as a preverb that means "start to," that goes along with the complimentary pini preverb "to stop"

owe.definition: Orwelliano, totalitario, di o relativo al Grande Fratello (da 1984), antonimo di kamalawala
owe.etymology: Orwell: inglese, George Orwell, author of 1984

pakala.definition: danneggiato, rotto, rovinato, ferito, incasinato; errore
pakala.etymology: bagarap: Tok Pisin, accident; bugger up: inglese, bugger up

pake.definition: fermare, cessare, fermarsi; bloccare la strada, interrompere; impedire

pakola.etymology: pakala: toki pona, broken, damaged, harmed, destroyed

pali.definition: lavoro, attività; creare, costruire, progettare; impegnarsi

palisa.definition: cosa lunga e dura; ramo, asta, bastone

pan.definition: cereale, grano; orzo, mais, avena, riso, frumento; pane, pasta
pan.etymology: pan: Romance, bread; パン (pan): giapponese, bread; pão: Portuguese, bread

pana.definition: dare, inviare, emettere, fornire, mettere, rilasciare
pana.etymology: panna: finlandese, put, set, place; pana: Swahili, give to each other

penpo.commentary: Coined in reference to ma pona pi toki pona's "tenpo pi toki pona taso" event, shortening it to "tenpo penpo".
penpo.etymology: (pi) toki pona taso: toki pona, only toki pona

pi.commentary: The usage of "pi" to mean "of" (marking a possessor) is heavily discouraged nowadays, preferring it to only be used for regrouping within phrases.
pi.definition: (particella) [raggruppa le parole seguenti in un singolo modificatore per la parola precedente]
pi.etymology: bilong: Tok Pisin, of; belong: inglese, belong

pika.definition: elettrico, elettronico, conduttivo, meccanico, online; elettricità, fulmine, tuono, rete
pika.etymology: ピカチュウ (Pikachū): giapponese, Pikachū, an electric Pokémon

pilin.definition: esperire per esempio un'emozione, una sensazione, un tocco; cuore (fisico o emotivo)
pilin.etymology: pilim: Tok Pisin, feel; -im: inglese, him; him: inglese, him

pini.commentary: Some proficient speakers use pini as a preverb that means "to stop," that goes along with the complimentary open preverb "start to"
pini.definition: tempo fa, completato, finito, terminato, passato
pini.etymology: fini: Acadian French, finished, completed; pinis: Tok Pisin, finish (perfective aspect); finish: inglese, finish

poka.definition: fianco, lato; vicino a, accanto a, nelle vicinanze | ALT insieme a (comitativo), di fianco a

poki.commentary: poki is sometimes used as "category" or to express types of things. One example is roles or groups, in discord chat contexts
poki.definition: contenitore, borsa, ciotola, scatola, tazza, armadio, cassetto, recipiente
poki.etymology: bokis: Tok Pisin, box, female genitalia (vulgar); box: inglese, box

pona.definition: buono, positivo, utile; amichevole, pacifico; semplice

powe.definition: irreale, falso, non veritiero; fingere; ingannare, raggirare
powe.etymology: pas vrai: Acadian French, not true

pu.commentary: For ways to buy a copy of the book, visit the official Toki Pona website.
pu.definition: interagire con il libro Toki Pona: The Language of Good di Sonja Lang
pu.etymology: 樸 (pǔ): mandarino, unworked wood, sincere, honest, inherent quality, simple; book: inglese, book

puwa.definition: soffice, morbido, gommoso (qualcosa che può essere compresso e che cercherà di tornare alla sua forma originale)
puwa.etymology: ふわふわ (fuwafuwa): giapponese, fluffy things (onomatopoeia)

sama.definition: stesso, simile; (aggettivo) pari, l'un l'altro; (preposizione) come, similmente a
sama.etymology: sama: finlandese, same; *samaz: Proto-Germanic, same, alike; sama: Esperanto, same; same: inglese, same

san.commentary:
More popular than the synonymous (and older) tuli.
san was also part of a set of 10 digit words created by jan Lenoka: lenke, jatu, ini, san, se, nun, loku, take, patu, kajo (0 through 9). All of these coinages except for san lack notability to be included in the main dictionary. They can be found in the sandbox.
san.etymology: 三 (san): giapponese, tre; 三 (sāam): Cantonese, tre; 叁 (sāam): Cantonese, tre

seli.commentary: In pu, definitions of seli are described as adjectives. ku's pu corrections clarify that these refer to nouns instead.
seli.definition: fuoco; elemento di combustione, reazione chimica, fonte di calore

selo.definition: strato esteriore, per esempio pelle, buccia, guscio, corteccia; forma esteriore, contorno, confine
selo.etymology: ŝelo: Esperanto, skin, peel; schale: German, peel, husk, shell

sewi.definition: area al di sopra, parte più alta, qualcosa di elevato; soggezione, divino, sacro, soprannaturale

sijelo.definition: corpo, forma, stato fisico, torso, sostanza, forma

sike.definition: cosa rotonda o circolare; palla, cerchio, ciclo, sfera, ruota; di un anno

sin.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "sin" and "namako" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "namako" at all, preferring "sin" in all circumstances.
sin.definition: nuovo, fresco; aggiuntivo, un altro, extra

sinpin.etymology: 前邊 (tsin bin): Cantonese, in front

sitelen.definition: immagine, figura, rappresentazione, simbolo, marchio, scrittura

sona.definition: conoscere, essere esperto, essere saggio, avere informazioni su; (pv.) sapere come

soweli.etymology: ცხოველი (cxoveli): georgiano, beastly animal, lively, passionate

su.commentary: This word was originally coined in ku as a reserved word for jan Sonja's future use. It was redefined upon the release of the first su book, making its status as a ku word debatable.
su.definition: interagire con un libro facente parte della serie di libri di racconti illustrati il cui primo elemento è The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, prodotto da Sonja Lang

suli.definition: grande, pesante, grosso, lungo, alto; importante; adulto

suno.definition: sole; luce, luminosità, bagliore, radiosità, splendore; fonte di luce

supa.definition: superficie orizzontale, cosa su cui mettere o appoggiare qualcosa
supa.etymology: surfaco: Esperanto, surface; surface: Acadian French, surface; surface: inglese, surface

sutopatikuna.commentary: Coined by Alexandre Baudry in 2009 in response to jan Sonja coining "kijetesantakalu" as part of 2009's April Fools.
sutopatikuna.etymology: čudnovati kljunaš: Serbo-Croatian, platypus, (literally) strange beak

suwi.etymology: swit: Tok Pisin, sweet; sweet: inglese, sweet

taki.definition: appiccicoso, magnetico; legare, attrarre, attaccare, agganciare
taki.etymology: 탁 (tag): coreano, the sound of two magnets hitting each other (onomatopoeia)

tan.definition: (preposizione) da, a causa di, perché; causa, origine

taso.commentary: Some proficient speakers use taso as a connector between sentences (X taso Y), similar to "X, but Y," as though taso behaved like la grammatically.
taso.etymology: tasol: Tok Pisin, just, only, but, however; that’s all: inglese, that’s all

tawa.definition: andare a, verso; per; dalla prospettiva di; muoversi | ALT (pv.) stando

te.commentary: May be paired with "to", or used on its own. It is unclear how accepted either approach is among te / to users.

telo.definition: acqua, liquido, fluido, sostanza umida; bevande

tenpo.definition: tempo, durata, momento, occasione, periodo, situazione
tenpo.etymology: tempo: Esperanto, time; tempus: Latin, time

to.commentary: May be paired with "te", or used on its own. It is unclear how accepted either approach is among te / to users.

toki.definition: comunicare, dire, parlare, conversare, usare il linguaggio, pensare; ciao
toki.etymology: tok: Tok Pisin, talk; talk: inglese, talk

tomo.definition: spazio interno; edificio, casa, abitazione, stanza
tomo.etymology: domo: Esperanto, house; dom: Polish, house; domus: Latin, house; δόμος: Ancient Greek, house

tonsi.commentary: Widely regarded in the community to be a crucial addition to toki pona. Occasionally referred to as an "honorary pu word" to highlight its status, or equated to a pu word outright.
tonsi.definition: non-binario, genere non conforme | ALT trans, non-cisgender
tonsi.etymology: 同志 (tóngzhì): mandarino, comrade (same will/purpose), LGBT+

tu.etymology: two: inglese, two; du: Esperanto, two

unpa.commentary: Also defined as "have marital relations with" in pu; removed due to potential confusion.

usawi.commentary: Originally, usawi also included "technology so complex it's impossible to tell apart from magic" in its meaning, but this meaning has been deprecated by the creator.
usawi.definition: magia, stregoneria; incantare; magico, soprannaturale, occulto, incomprensibile

uta.commentary: The dot in the "uta" sitelen pona is to distinguish luka-uta from moku.
uta.definition: bocca, labbra, gola, orefizio per l'alimentazione

utala.definition: combattere, sfidare, competere contro, lottare contro

wa.commentary: Sometimes analyzed as a variety of "a".

wasoweli.commentary: First used as the name for a species in a mod for Caves of Qud created by akesi kon Nalasuni. Later appeared in ku as exclusively part of a translation for "penguin".
wasoweli.definition: animale con qualità sia di waso che di soweli
wasoweli.etymology: waso: toki pona, bird, flying creature; soweli: toki pona, land animal, fuzzy creature

wawa.definition: forte, potente; fiducioso, sicuro; energico, intenso

wekama.definition: lasciare e ritornare, essere temporaneamente assente con l'aspettativa di ritornare
wekama.etymology: weka kama: toki pona, 'leave-arrive', to leave and come back

wile.definition: deve, bisogno, richiedere, dovrebbe, vuole, desidera

wuwojiti.commentary: May be seen not as a word in toki pona, but as a kind of memorisation tool in English to refer to the "banned" syllables. Occasionally extended to wuwojitinmanna to include the illegal consecutive nasal consonants.
wuwojiti.definition: usare una o più delle sillabe non permesse wu, wo, ji, ti; infrangere le regole fonotattiche del toki pona
wuwojiti.etymology: wu: toki pona, (sound); wo: toki pona, (sound); ji: toki pona, (sound); ti: toki pona, (sound)

yupekosi.commentary: Coined as a random keystroke. It is presumed jan Sonja used "y" by mistake, but then made it part of the joke by adding "nobody knows how to pronounce the y".
yupekosi.definition: comportarsi come George Lucas e rivedere i propri vecchi lavori creativi e in realtà renderli peggiori
